title: Drawing, "Design for Fretwork", 1803 or earlier
medium: Pen and blue and black ink,  watercolor on white wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Design for fretwork at the Royal Pavilion, Brighton, perhaps for the glass passage.  Horizontal rectangle.  Elevation of a section of a wall, with the design of a series of columns with lattice-work patterns between them.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Fretwork", 1803 or earlier.
1803 or earlier. Pen and blue and black ink,  watercolor on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-51.
